name: Psychedelic Folk
description: Acoustic forms that capture an atmosphere that is at turns dream-like, 'spaced-out', whimsical, haunting, mystical, and melancholic.

children.name: Freak Folk
children.description: Loosely defined 2000s Psychedelic Folk revival closely associated with the New Weird America movement, sometimes also a shorthand for certain leftfield styles of psychedelic and Indie Folk.

children.name: Freak Folk
children.description: Loosely defined 2000s Psychedelic Folk revival closely associated with the New Weird America movement, sometimes also a shorthand for certain leftfield styles of psychedelic and Indie Folk.

children.name: Free Folk
children.description: Incorporates improvisation, repetition and extended song lengths.

children.name: Free Folk
children.description: Incorporates improvisation, repetition and extended song lengths.

children.name: Udigrudi
children.description: Movement that emerged in the Brazilian city of Recife during the 1970s that combines psychedelic elements with music of Northeastern Brazil.

children.name: Wyrd Folk
children.description: Closely tied to mysticism, old folk beliefs, and Folk Horror; often described as 'witchy' or 'pagan.'
